original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares edge down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up during mid day trade on Thursday, the market is moving on slower trends due to the holiday season pushing investing down, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was up 0.62 percent or 56.53 points to 9,230.50, the most liquid index was 0.44 percent or 11.60 points to 2,675.87.
“The market is unlikely to cross 1 billion in turnover,” the analyst said.
Top gainers were Sampath Bank, Ceylon Tobacco Company and Richard Pieris Company.
